requirement: Internally to the CPN, a CNG transmitting private or other critical information (i.e. to a CND) shall protect the data from unauthorised disclosure.
label: sec

requirement: Internally to the CPN, a CNG receiving private or other critical information (i.e. from a CND) should verify that the data was protected from unauthorised disclosure.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall detect the end of the life of the key used for cryptographic protection of the wireless communication between the CND and the CNG.
label: sec

requirement: A CPN-user attempting to invoke a CNG-mediated service shall be identified and authenticated by the CNG before being granted access to the service.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall implement an authentication failure handling policy.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall take action according to local authentication failure handling policy (which may include silently discarding the authentication and explicit failure notification, or in the case of a replay of credentials may include notification of the true owner of the credentials) upon detection of failure during identification, authentication and authorization.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG should detect replayed user and/or device credentials.
label: sec

requirement: When the CNG detects replayed user and/or device credentials, the CNG shall stop the relevant processes.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall implement a privacy protection policy specifying as a minimum private and critical information.
label: sec

requirement: When the CNG detects violation of the privacy protection policy the CNG shall discard all signalling, including signalling from the NGN.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall implement an authorization management handling policy.
label: sec

requirement: On reception at the CNG of a message to access configuration information for update and detection of authorization failure the CNG shall reject the request and manage the failure in accordance with the CPN authorization management handling policy.
label: sec

requirement: Where a CND invokes a session at the CNG the CNG shall record the association of session-id, invoking device identity and invoking user-id.
label: sec

requirement: On transmission of management information from the CNG to a CND the CNG shall append a timestamp or sequence number to the outgoing message.
label: sec

requirement: On reception at the CNG of a message containing management information the CNG shall extract the timestamp or sequence number and verify that the message has not been replayed.
label: sec

requirement: On reception at the CNG of a message to access or update configuration information the CNG shall allow access only if the sender is an administrator.
label: sec

requirement: On detection of a message integrity error at the CNG the CNG shall discard the message.
label: sec

requirement: On indication received at the CNG of a resource allocation expiry the CNG shall delete all residual data associated with the invocation of the resource.
label: sec

requirement: On receipt of a valid (i.e. authorized) request for data stored in the CNG the CNG shall return the requested data to the requesting user.
label: sec

requirement: On receipt of a valid (i.e. authorized) request for access to a CNG hosted service or application the CNG shall provide the requested service or application to the requesting user.
label: sec

requirement: On detection of any system failure or discontinuity not specifically handled by other mechanisms the CNG shall revert to a known safe state.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for connectivity purposes.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for service usage purposes.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate CNDs to the NGN for service usage purposes if they are not able to fully support the related procedures in an autonomous way.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms for authentication of wireless CNDs for local connectivity. Similar mechanisms may be also implemented for non-wireless devices.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and CPN shall support mechanisms that prevent access to the network by unauthorized users.
label: sec

requirement: The capacity of the authorized entities should depend on the security policies defined by the service providers, managing the CNG.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and the CPN shall implement mechanisms to limit the visibility of the WAN side network and resources to authorized entities.
label: sec

requirement: The diagnostic operations on the CPN by an operator shall be performed in accordance with rules protecting the users' privacy.
label: sec

requirement: CPN environment shall be protected with a stateful firewall function, that may be implemented in the CNG.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and the CPN shall be able to support parental control related functionalities limiting the use of the broadband connection on a user or time basis. Limitations on a content basis may be shared with devoted network servers.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall be equipped with a WAN interface towards the NGN, implementing layer 1 and 2 functionalities ("one-box" solution).
label: nonsec

requirement: LAN interfaces. The CNG shall be equipped with at least one Ethernet (minimum 100 Mbit/s) is interface. Optional interfaces could be present, e.g.: wireless LAN Wi-Fi Alliance certified, Powerlines, Plastic Optical Fiber, USB device and/or host, one or more FXS for analog telephony, DECT Cat-iq.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support both routed and bridged modes of operation.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support direct intra-LAN connectivity between any appropriate pair of devices on the Customer Premises Network.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support different IP address schemes and subnets on the same physical LAN port, and on different LAN ports, irrespective of routed or bridged mode of operation, allowing the direct addressability of CNDs from the NGN side in relation to data plane, control plane and management plane flows.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and devices shall support mechanisms to identify and share information about the customer network devices (e.g. type of device and basic capabilities, services supported etc.) within the customer environment. Some of this information can be used locally, while a subset of it can be forwarded to the NGN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support use of one user identity on several terminals as well as to share one terminal with several identities.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall support the NGN services usage (e.g. voice communications, video communications, IPTV, entertainment, ) allowing the connection to the right service control platforms.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG should support redirection of IP Multimedia sessions, as defined by TS 181 005 [1], independently from the type of device used (NGN terminal or other CND).
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall assure the confidentiality, the integrity of signalling/control/media and management flows.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall provide the opportunity for a customer network administrator to perform service and network-related configuration. According to the service/network provider choices, the CNG and Customer Network may prevent - user initiated modification of network and service related parameters.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG should negotiate session parameters (bandwidth, screen resolution, codecs) with the NGN transparently to the user.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN shall support remote access, based on NGN network functions.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall allow the customer remote access to a CND in the Customer Network, for example a surveillance video camera.
label: nonsec

requirement: Standard NGN authentication, routing and connectivity should be used to establish remote access connectivity.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may use multiple tunnel connections for providing e.g. adequate QoS for the remote access user.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may allow secure dynamic firewall opening for remote access devices based on NGN authentication functions.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may provide Home to Home (H2H) communication service  connecting CNDs in  different CPNs.
label: nonsec

requirement: If Home to Home (H2H) communication service is provided, then each CNG must limit access to local CNDs and/or media classes based on the access rights of the remote H2H user identity.
label: nonsec

requirement: If Home to Home (H2H) communication service is provided, then each CNG must ensure that emergency service sessions originating in its CPN are associated with the appropriate location information and/or calling identity.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN may support encrypted communication with remote access devices, and the encrypted communication can be terminated either at the CNG or CND.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may act as a proxy for handling messages (requests and responses) related to the remote access scenarios to and from the home.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may support mechanisms supporting nomadism of the users and their subscribed services from one physical customer environment to another.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG should be able to assist in establishing Rich Communication Suite sessions between CNDs, including joining/splitting voice & media streams.
label: nonsec

requirement: It should be possible for more than one identity to be associated with a single CPN subscription.
label: nonsec

requirement: It should be possible for a service profile to be associated with each identity within a CPN subscription.
label: nonsec

requirement: It shall be possible for a single public identity to be associated with multiple CNDs where each association is allocated a unique private identity.
label: nonsec

requirement: Multiple public identities on the same terminal shall be supported.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forking towards customer non-IMS capable devices.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall able to store information related to private identities of non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forwarding toward non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support intra-CPN communication between IMS and non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The customer environment (CNG and/or CNDs) should support a mechanism to allow service roaming
label: nonsec
zero_shot_cot: It is not possible to definitively label this requirement as either 'sec' or 'nonsec' without additional context, as the concept of service roaming itself can have both security and non-security implications. However, I will provide reasoning for both possibilities: sec and nonsec. This response is intended to help guide further discussion on the topic.

requirement: The NGN network should be provided with a CND location information.
label: nonsec

requirement: Codec requirements and capabilities for the User Equipment (including the CNG) are already defined in TS181 005 [1] which describes service requirements and capabilities for the TISPAN NGN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms for managing IPTV flows provided both in unicast and multicast mode.
label: nonsec

requirement: In case of multicast flows the CNG shall keep a record of which devices are subscribed to which multicast group.
label: nonsec

requirement: An IPTV media flow shall be terminated by a STB or by a specific device called "media gateway" (or "application gateway"). The CNG shall not terminate any IPTV flow by itself.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support the connection to a STB (or media gateway) both in a bridged or in a routed mode of operation.
label: nonsec

requirement: Depending on the operation mode chosen (bridged or touted) and on the type of flow treated (unicast or multicast) the CNG shall forward packets only to the physical interfaces which are connected to devices interested to the IPTV flow.
label: nonsec

requirement: In case of multicast streams the CNG should support proxy functionalities to optimize the management of information related to signalling.
label: nonsec

requirement: CNG shall perform a link layer multicast to unicast translation if the STB or media gateway are connected using customer network technologies not supporting multicast flows (e.g. powerlines, wireless).
label: nonsec

requirement: STB or media gateways should be equipped with a programmable open API allowing the implementation of specific service logics.
label: nonsec

requirement: Functionalities related to Electronic Programming Guide and DRM management shall be implemented in STB or media gateway and not in CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: Media flows (data plane) transcoding shall be performed by STB or media gateway and not by the CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: Protocols adaptation for control plane or management plane may be performed by CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: Presence related information shall be sent to the NGN by the STB or the CNG (depending on the specific architectural choices, CNG could manage the presence related information on behalf of the specific device used) to enable specific services tailored on the specific user's profile.
label: nonsec

requirement: CPN should support user generated content (UGC) using  an NGN service.
label: nonsec

requirement: CPN should support storage of UGC within the CPN.
label: nonsec

requirement: Subject to applicable regulation, UGC media streams may be sent directly from one CPN to one or multiple other CPN.
label: nonsec

requirement: CPN should support bookmarks (e.g. hyperlinks) to stored and streaming user-generated content in order to store and exchange references to uploaded and streaming UGC,.
label: nonsec

requirement: The user should be able to personalize bookmarks to UGC.
label: nonsec

requirement: CPN should support inter-destination content synchronisation of streaming multimedia content. This should achieve that all or a specific group of users consuming specific content get the content presented simultaneously, i.e. without user-noticeable delay difference.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the CPN shall support adequate Quality of Service mechanisms (e.g. prioritize the traffic in the event that there is not sufficient bandwidth in the customer network in order to ensure the correct network performances to each traffic flow). To achieve this objective a number of functionalities shall be supported by CNG and/or CNDs, as defined in the following bullets. Most of the following set of requirements is defined adopting as a reference the Home Gateway Initiative (HGI) Release 1 Specification mentioned in clause 2 [6].
label: nonsec

requirement: The NGN network QoS functions shall be possible to use to enhance the end-user experience.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may interact with the Resource and Admission Control Subsystem (RACS) as defined in ES 282 001 [9] to support remote real-time QoS control
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may interact with network elements inside the CPN to support QoS control inside the CPN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall classify packets entering the CPN through its WAN interface (downstream direction) according to a number of predefined priorities. Classification can be done on the basis of different layer 2 and/or layer 3 parameters.
label: nonsec

requirement: The number of possible values defining the packet priority and, by consequence, the number of queues managed in the downstream direction shall be coherent with the number of concurrent services (data, communication, entertainment) to be treated and supported.
label: nonsec

requirement: When forwarding packets from the WAN interface to the customer network, the CNG shall perform one of the following three actions, depending on the classification results: manage a number of queues corresponding to the different priorities detected in the classification phase for each packet processed, send the packets to some internal buffers or simply drop the packet.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall classify packets coming from the CPN through its LAN interfaces (upstream direction) according to a number of predefined priorities. Classification can be done on the basis of different layer 2 and/or layer 3 parameters.
label: nonsec

requirement: The number of possible values defining the packet priority and, by consequence, the number of queues managed in the upstream direction shall be coherent with the number of concurrent services (data, communication, entertainment) to be treated and supported.
label: nonsec

requirement: When forwarding packets from the customer network to the WAN interface, the CNG shall manage a number of queues corresponding to the different priorities detected in the classification phase for each packet processed.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall be able to classify intra-LAN traffic that is simply bridged by the CNG itself within the CPN.
label: nonsec

requirement: Traffic marking: depending on what are the parameters used to perform classification, CNDs or CNG itself on behalf of the CNDs shall be able to modify the packets' priority.
label: nonsec

requirement: In case of huge amount of traffic in upstream or downstream directions, a congestion management mechanism shall be implemented in the CNG to minimize the impact from the user experience point of view.
label: nonsec

requirement: In case of managed services, QoS rules applied by CNG shall be configurable by a remote management system.
label: nonsec

requirement: In case of unmanaged services, user shall be able to access a QoS configuration function implemented in the CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: CNG shall be equipped with an application client to be remotely manageable by the service providers for configuration, monitoring, firmware upgrade purposes. In case of multiple service providers multiple clients configuring different sets of parameters (for example referring to different services) may be present. A single parameter can be modified by a single client only.
label: nonsec

requirement: It shall be possible to configure the CNG (e.g. firmware downloading) according to the subscribed services. This operation may be performed when the CNG is connected to the network for the first time, for each new service subscription/modification, or for any technical management (e.g. security, patches, etc.).
label: nonsec

requirement: CNG shall support mechanisms for secure authentication and communication with the remote management system.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall be associated with a unique Hardware ID to be used for identification NGN side.
label: nonsec

requirement: A suitably authorized CPN user (e.g. the system administrator) shall be able to install and activate NGN managed services without the intervention of the subscribing CPN user.
label: nonsec

requirement: A suitably authorized CPN user (e.g. the system administrator) shall be able to manage and configure the provisioning, capabilities and use of NGN managed services from an NGN access point outside the CPN.
label: nonsec

requirement: A CPN user shall be able to configure any unmanaged service provided to the user.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG Remote Management requires to manage a specific set of parameters. At least the following list of parameters shall be available: Customer Identification, Physical Line Identification, list of subscribed services, CNG IP address.
label: nonsec

requirement: For the CNG management it is recommended to use a single protocol, so as to minimize the complexity and the cost of the service.
label: nonsec

requirement: CNDs connected to the CPN and devoted to specific NGN managed services shall be remotely manageable.
label: nonsec

requirement: CNG shall support mechanisms allowing the CNDs remote management when applicable.
label: nonsec

requirement: Protection mechanisms shall be implemented to avoid that a management client could access and modify parameters that is not allow to configure.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN (trough CNDs and/or CNG) shall support manual configuration to insert information to access IMS network (e.g. IMPU, IMPI, Shared keys, Home Network Domain or P-CSCF IP Address, etc.).
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND directly or through the CNG must be able to access to Network Configuration Service Function without involving any user interaction.
label: nonsec

requirement: The Network Configuration Server should be able to upload different parameter sets related to service subscription.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND should be able to support bootstrap capabilities in order to retrieve network configuration data to connect the NGN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND/CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the user to manually modify the association between a public identity (e.g. phone number) and a specific private identity corresponding to a single customer device not provided with a UICC and corresponding also to legal service level agreements between the user and the service provider.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN (CND and/or CNG) shall support a method to access a Self Configuration Server.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN should support a capability to ensure QoS and call prioritization for sessions originating or terminating in the H(e)NB.
label: nonsec

requirement: A CND, as defined in clause 3, may use the CNG to access NGN services.
label: nonsec

requirement: Authorized users shall be able to access NGN-based services using any NGN supported home device.
label: nonsec

requirement: Both IMS capable devices with or without UICC and non-IMS capable devices without UICC shall be supported.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the CND contains an ISIM/UICC, it shall support the AKA authentication method (TS 187 001 [8])
label: nonsec

requirement: If the CND does not contain an ISIM/UICC, it shall support the HTTP Digest authentication or the NBA
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND shall provide its registration identity, when it requires the registration to the network.
label: nonsec

requirement: In order to support the NGN services and intra-CPN communications, all the CNDs in the CPN shall be addressable directly or by the mean of the CNG using L2/L3 mechanisms.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND should support protocols for remote access management.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND should support protocol for local authentication in CPN/CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND shall support the NGN services usage (e.g. voice communications, video communications, IPTV, entertainment, etc.) allowing the connection to the right service control platforms to process the media.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND shall support protocol to access the NGN service layer platforms.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND shall support protocols to access Self Configuration application (as defined in clause 4.1).
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND shall be able to download and install client application services.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND should be able to communicate its services related capabilities to the CNG.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CND should be able to support one or more codecs for communication services (as defined by TS181 005 [1]).
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for connectivity purposes.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate itself to the NGN for service usage purposes.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms to authenticate CNDs to the NGN for service usage purposes if they are not able to fully support the related procedures in an autonomous way.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall support mechanisms for authentication of wireless CNDs for local connectivity. Similar mechanisms may be also implemented for non-wireless devices.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and CPN shall support mechanisms that prevent access to the network by unauthorized users.
label: sec

requirement: The capacity of the authorized entities should depend on the security policies defined by the service providers, managing the CNG.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and the CPN shall implement mechanisms to limit the visibility of the WAN side network and resources to authorized entities.
label: sec

requirement: The diagnostic operations on the CPN by an operator shall be performed in accordance with rules protecting the users' privacy.
label: sec

requirement: CPN environment shall be protected with a stateful firewall function, that may be implemented in the CNG.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG and the CPN shall be able to support parental control related functionalities limiting the use of the broadband connection on a user or time basis. Limitations on a content basis may be shared with devoted network servers.
label: sec

requirement: The CNG shall be equipped with a WAN interface towards the NGN, implementing layer 1 and 2 functionalities ("one-box" solution).
label: nonsec

requirement: LAN interfaces. The CNG shall be equipped with at least one Ethernet (minimum 100 Mbit/s) is interface. Optional interfaces could be present, e.g.: wireless LAN Wi-Fi Alliance certified, Powerlines, Plastic Optical Fiber, USB device and/or host, one or more FXS for analog telephony, DECT Cat-iq.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support both routed and bridged modes of operation.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support direct intra-LAN connectivity between any appropriate pair of devices on the Customer Premises Network.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support different IP address schemes and subnets on the same physical LAN port, and on different LAN ports, irrespective of routed or bridged mode of operation, allowing the direct addressability of CNDs from the NGN side in relation to data plane, control plane and management plane flows.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and devices shall support mechanisms to identify and share information about the customer network devices (e.g. type of device and basic capabilities, services supported etc.) within the customer environment. Some of this information can be used locally, while a subset of it can be forwarded to the NGN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support use of one user identity on several terminals as well as to share one terminal with several identities.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall support the NGN services usage (e.g. voice communications, video communications, IPTV, entertainment, ) allowing the connection to the right service control platforms.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG should support or not prevent redirection of IP Multimedia sessions, as defined by TS 181 005 [1], independently from the type of device used (NGN terminal or other CND).
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall assure the confidentiality, the integrity of signalling/control/media and management flows.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG and the Customer Network shall provide the opportunity for a customer network administrator to perform service and network-related configuration. According to the service/network provider choices, the CNG and Customer Network may prevent - user initiated modification of network and service related parameters.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG should negotiate session parameters (bandwidth, screen resolution, codecs) with the NGN transparently to the user.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN shall support secure remote access control, based on NGN network functions.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall allow the customer remote access to a CND in the Customer Network, for example a surveillance video camera.
label: nonsec

requirement: Standard NGN authentication, routing and connectivity should be used to establish remote access connectivity.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may allow secure dynamic firewall opening for remote access devices based on NGN authentication functions.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CPN may support encrypted communication with remote access devices, and the encrypted communication can be terminated either at the CNG or CND.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may act as a proxy for handling messages (requests and responses) related to the remote access scenarios to and from the home.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG may support mechanisms supporting nomadism of the users and their subscribed services from one physical customer environment to another.
label: nonsec

requirement: Multiple identities should be supported within the same subscription. Personal service profiles per each identity within the same subscription should be supported. A shared public identity on several terminals, with different private identities, shall be supported (shared IMPU).
label: nonsec

requirement: Multiple public identities on the same terminal shall be supported.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forking towards customer non-IMS capable devices and shall able to store information related to private identities of non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support a mechanism allowing the support of call forwarding toward non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The CNG shall support intra-CPN communication between IMS and non-IMS capable CNDs.
label: nonsec

requirement: The customer environment (CNG and/or CNDs) should support a mechanism to allow service roaming
label: nonsec
zero_shot_cot: It is not possible to definitively label this requirement as either 'sec' or 'nonsec' without additional context, as the concept of service roaming itself can have both security and non-security implications. However, I will provide reasoning for both possibilities: sec and nonsec. This response is intended to help guide further discussion on the topic.

requirement: Successful authentication is a prerequisite for the processing of any on-line or offline CEPS transaction
label: sec

requirement: On-line authentication must take place between the card issuer and the CEP card for load, unload, and currency exchange transactions
label: sec

requirement: The card issuer and the CEP card share a secret key to generate and verify MACs
label: sec

requirement: Off-line authentication must take place between a PSAM in the POS device and the CEP card for purchase and cancel last purchase transactions
label: sec

requirement: The card and the PSAM must use a public key algorithm for mutual authentication and session key exchange, as no permanent shared secret key may exist between the CEP card and the PSAM
label: sec

requirement: To load value into a slot of the CEP card securely, the load device establishes a connection between the issuer and the CEP card
label: sec

requirement: The card should use a unique diversified secret key, personalized into the card, to generate and authenticate transaction signatures
label: sec

requirement: If this is not a cash load, the funds issuer needs to verify that the funds are requested by the legitimate account owner, which is normally done by the presentation of an enciphered PIN
label: sec

requirement: The card issuer needs to ensure that the load acquirer is guaranteeing payment for the electronic value, and that the card is authentic
label: sec

requirement: The load acquirer needs to ensure that the issuer is the true owner of the card, and, in the case of an apparent failure of the load, the load acquirer needs the card presented to authenticate the failure
label: sec

requirement: The load device sends S1 in an authorization request to the issuer
label: sec

requirement: The load device also provides for verification of the identity of the cardholder (with either on-line or off-line PIN verification) and forwards verification data in the authorization request
label: sec

requirement: The issuer validates S1 to authenticate the card and the data to be used in the transaction
label: sec

requirement: The issuer sends S2 to the load acquirer in the authorization response message
label: sec
zero_shot_cot: It is not possible to definitively label S2 as either 'sec' or 'nonsec' without specific details about the context, protocol, and content of the message S2 in the authorization response. However, generally speaking, S2 could be considered a security-related requirement if it contains sensitive information such as encryption keys, digital certificates, or other security parameters. On the other hand, if S2 contains non-security related data like transaction details or merchant information, it would likely be labeled as 'nonsec'.

requirement: Unloads are permitted only to an account controlled by the card issuer and are performed only at a load device under the control of the card issuer
label: sec

requirement: The cardholder must have an account relationship with the card issuer, and funds removed from the card are credited to the cardholder account only after the card issuer authenticates the card
label: sec

requirement: The issuer needs only to authenticate the card, and the card needs only to authenticate the issuer and that the data is the same as used by the issuer
label: sec

requirement: The card generates S1, using data from the card and load device, and sends S1 to the card issuer to authenticate the card and the data that is to be used in the transaction
label: sec

requirement: The card issuer generates S2, which is sent to the card to allow the card to validate the card issuer??s authenticity and to ensure that the data used by the card in the transaction is the same as the card issuer intended
label: sec

requirement: In the case of an unsuccessful completion, exception processing outlined in the On-line Exception Processing section is performed
label: nonsec

requirement: During a purchase transaction, the CEP card must ensure that it is dealing with an authentic POS device, and it must generate a signature to allow the card issuer to verify the integrity of the transaction
label: sec

requirement: The POS device must ensure that it is dealing with an authentic card, and guarantee integrity of transactions and batches to the merchant acquirer
label: sec

requirement: In the case of a reversal, the CEP card must re-authenticate the PSAM
label: sec

requirement: The card must ensure that the transaction is performed by the same POS device as was used for the purchase being canceled, and that the amount of the cancellation is the same as the amount of the purchase, or, in the case of an incremental purchase, the same as the amount of the last step
label: sec

requirement: During a Cancel Last Purchase transaction, the CEP card is authenticated by the PSAM in the POS device
label: sec

requirement: The PSAM authenticates that the purchase transaction being canceled was performed by the PSAM, and that the transaction being canceled is part of the active batch
label: sec

requirement: The card issuer and the merchant acquirer also authenticate the transaction when they receive it
label: sec

requirement: Transmissions between host systems should be protected by MACs based on unique keys that are shared by the nodes involved
label: sec

requirement: The transaction signatures ensure end to end integrity of transmitted data for load, unload, and currency exchange transactions
label: sec

requirement: These totals are used by the merchant acquirer to ensure the integrity of the batch
label: sec
zero_shot_cot: It is not possible to determine the label ('sec' or 'nonsec') based solely on the information provided about the totals. The labels depend on the specific security-related requirements and non-security-related requirements defined by the merchant acquirer, which are not specified in this context.

requirement: The count and amount of the transactions in the batch must be protected by the S4 MAC,  This information is not part of the card issuer??s verification process
label: sec

requirement: Scheme providers must assign unique identifying numbers to merchant acquirers who provide PSAMs
label: sec

requirement: These merchant acquirers must then assign unique identifiers to PSAMs
label: sec
zero_shot: It is not possible for me to definitively label this requirement as either 'sec' or 'nonsec', as I do not have specific knowledge about the context, roles, and responsibilities of PSAMs (Point-of-Sale Application Managers) in relation to merchant acquirers. However, assigning unique identifiers to any system component can be considered a best practice for maintaining system integrity and traceability, which may have security implications.

requirement: Each PSAM must maintain a transaction count, The unique PSAM ID and the transaction count are used during a conversation with a CEP card. The transaction count must not be reset during the life of the PSAM
label: sec

requirement: Contain the CA public RSA key, the PSAM??s private RSA key and optionally the certificates that the POS device uses to perform mutual authentication with the CEP card
label: sec

requirement: Perform the calculation required to generate a signature using the PSAM??s private RSA key, to allow the CEP card to validate the PSAM
label: sec
zero_shot: To generate a signature using the PSAM's private RSA key, you would typically follow these steps: (Please note that I can't actually perform the operation, but I can guide you through the process.) Here's an outline of the steps: 1. Hash the message to be signed. This is usually done with a secure hash function like SHA-256 or SHA-384. 2. requirement: At OP_READY state,Executable Load Files that were included in Immutable Persistent Memory shall be registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry
label: nonsec

requirement: At OP_READY, initial key shall be available within the issuer security domain
label: nonsec

requirement: The off-card entity under the OP_READY state may insert Security Domain keys  in order to maintain a cryptographic key separation from the Issuer Security Domain keys
label: sec

requirement: The SECURED state may be used to enforce the relevant security policies of the security domain and applications
label: sec
zero_shot_cot: It is not possible to determine the label ('sec' or 'nonsec') without knowing the specific requirement or context within the security domain and application.

requirement: The off-card entity under the SECURE state shall be used to ensure the availability of all keys by the issuer security domain
label: sec

requirement: The CARD_LOCKED state shall has the ability to disable the selected security domain and application
label: nonsec

requirement: The card under CARD_LOCKED state shall only allow the application to select the final application privilege
label: nonsec
zero_shot_cot: To determine whether the label should be 'sec' or 'nonsec', we need to understand the context of the 'CARD_LOCKED' state in this system. Since the card is locked, it implies that there might be some security measures in place to prevent unauthorized access. Therefore, any action taken on a locked card, such as selecting an application privilege label, could potentially have security implications. Thus, it would be reasonable to categorize this requirement as 'sec' (security-related).

requirement: The Card Content changes including any type of data management (specifically Security Domain keys and data) shall not allowed in the CARD_LOCKED state.
label: nonsec

requirement: The state TERMINATED shall be used to permanently disable all card functionality with respect to any card content management and any life cycle changes.
label: nonsec

requirement: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Command Dispatch functions (Application and Security Domain selection, (Optional) Logical channel management, Command dispatching) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
label: nonsec

requirement: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Card Content Management functions (Content verification, Content loading, Content installation, Content removal, Access control rules for card content management) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
label: nonsec

requirement: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports Security Management functions (Security Domain locking and unlocking, Application locking and unlocking, Card locking and unlocking, Card termination, Privilege usage, Security Domain, privilege usage, Tracing and event logging) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
label: nonsec

requirement: The GlobalPlatform Environment (OPEN) supports GlobalPlatform Trusted Framework functions (Secure inter-application communication) if the underlying runtime environment does not support them:
label: nonsec

requirement: The GlobalPlatform Registry is a data store required to support the various system functions of the GlobalPlatform.
label: nonsec

requirement: Applications and Security Domains may access andor modify some content known or managed by the OPEN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The commands received by a GlobalPlatform card shall be processed by the OPEN or dispatched to the selected Application for processing.
label: nonsec

requirement: The SELECT [by name] command is processed by the OPEN.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card is aware of logical channels but only supports the Basic Logical Channel, the OPEN shall respond with the appropriate error,
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card is aware of logical channels and supports at least one Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN shall process the command,
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the command shall be dispatched to the selected Application for processing.
label: nonsec

requirement: Any other type of command received shall be dispatched to the currently selected Application.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""Commands are either received on the Basic Logical Channel (logical channel number zero) or on a Supplementary Logical Channel (logical channel number other than zero). In compliance with ISO/IEC 7816-4, logical channel information shall be indicated in the class byte of the APDU command header."""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""For all commands, if the command indicates a Supplementary Logical Channel that is not opened then:   If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the command shall be dispatched to the selected Application for processing.   If the card is aware of logical channels, the OPEN shall respond with the appropriate error. (This requirement may exclude the SELECT command, if the card supports opening of a logical channel using the SELECT command.)"""
label: nonsec

requirement: For commands that are dispatched to an Application, it is the responsibility of the Application to correctly reject commands that it does not recognize, expect or cannot process.
label: nonsec

requirement: The Issuer Security Domain shall have no multi-selection restrictions on cards that support multiple logical channels i.e. it shall be capable of being selected across multiple logical channels.
label: nonsec

requirement: The Issuer Security Domain is by default the implicitly selectable Application on all logical channels of all card I/O interfaces supported by the card. Implicit selection on a specific logical channel of a specific card I/O interface may be assigned only if the Issuer Security Domain is the implicitly selectable Application on that logical channel of that card I/O interface and no other Locked Application is registered as implicitly selectable for the same logical channel and card I/O interface
label: nonsec

requirement: An Application installed or made selectable with a specific Implicit Selection parameter is registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry as the implicitly selectable Application on the logical channel(s) of the card I/O interface(s) indicated in the parameter if no other Application (other than the Issuer Security Domain) is already registered as implicitly selectable on that logical channel(s) of that card I/O interface(s),
label: nonsec

requirement: An Application installed or made selectable with the Card Reset privilege and no Implicit Selection parameter is registered in the GlobalPlatform Registry as the implicitly selectable Application on the Basic Logical Channel for all card I/O interfaces supported by the card if no other Application (other than the Issuer Security Domain) is already registered as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel of any card I/O interface,
label: nonsec

requirement: If an Application implicitly selectable on specific logical channel(s) of specific card I/O interface(s) is deleted, the Issuer Security Domain becomes the implicitly selectable Application on that logical channel(s) of that card I/O interface(s).
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""The OPEN shall use the implicit selection registration of each Application for controlling the following runtime behavioral requirements:   Identifying the Application which is implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel of the current card I/O interface during the card reset or activation sequence,   Identifying the Application which is implicitly selectable when opening on the current card I/O interface a new Supplementary Logical Channel from the Basic Logical Channel."""
label: nonsec

requirement: The Basic Logical Channel is the permanently available interface to a GlobalPlatform card and shall be supported by the OPEN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The OPEN shall support Application selection on the Basic Logical Channel via Implicit Selection following the card reset (see ISO/IEC 7816-3 for contact cards) or activation sequence (see ISO/IEC 14443-3 for contactless cards),
label: nonsec

requirement: The OPEN shall support Application selection on the Basic Logical Channel via Explicit Selection through the SELECT [by name] command.
label: nonsec

requirement: The OPEN may also support additional selection processes.
label: nonsec

requirement: Partial AID selection as defined in section 6.4.2.1.2 - Explicit Selection, shall be supported. (Partial AID selection does not require knowledge of the full AID by the off-card entity.)
label: nonsec

requirement: As multiple Applications on the card may have the same partial AID, it is required that a method exists to select all Applications matching the partial AID.
label: nonsec

requirement: Once the card session has been established (for contact cards according to ISO/IEC 7816-4 after Answer-to-Reset, or after the activation sequence for contactless cards according to ISO/IEC 14443-3), and before the first command is issued to the card, the Application defined as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel and for that card I/O interface shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel for that card I/O interface.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, the Application with the Final Application privilege is the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel and the OPEN shall not attempt to identify the implicitly selectable Application
label: nonsec

requirement: In all other cases the OPEN shall search the GlobalPlatform Registry for an Application that is marked as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for the current card I/O interface (e.g. contact or contactless), and if this Application is not in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, it shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel. If this is an Application in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, the Application with the Final Application privilege shall become the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel.
label: nonsec

requirement: At any time during a Card Session the OPEN may receive a request to select an Application on the Basic Logical Channel (SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command). The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches an entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
label: nonsec

requirement: At any time during a Card Session that has already contained a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command, the OPEN may receive a request to select a next Application (SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command) on the Basic Logical Channel. The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches another entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""For both the SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command and the SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command, an Application becomes the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel if:   The requested AID matches (fully or partially) the Applications AID,   The Application being selected is in the correct Life Cycle State,   The Application has no restrictions due to multi-selection, and supports the current card interface."""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""In the card Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED: - If the Application being selected has the Final Application privilege, this Application is re-selected and a warning is returned to the off-card entity, - If any other Application is being selected, the Application with the Final Application privilege remains selected and an error is returned to the off- card entity,"""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] or SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received and the data field of the command message is not present, the Issuer Security Domain shall become the currently selected Application and the SELECT command is dispatched to the Issuer Security Domain,"""
label: nonsec

requirement: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the start of the GlobalPlatform Registry,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the entry following the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel in the GlobalPlatform Registry,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State INSTALLED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. In the eventuality that this locked Application is already currently selected on the Basic Logical Channel, the OPEN shall terminate this Application Session. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction or because the Application refuses selection (e.g. because it does not support the current card interface), continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is selectable (i.e. in the correct Life Cycle State and has no multi-selection restrictions), then it shall become the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel and the SELECT [by name] command, whether [first or only occurrence] or [next occurrence], shall be processed according to the requirements of the runtime environment (e.g. dispatched to the Application),
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""If no full or partial match is found at all, the currently selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel shall remain the selected Application and - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [first or only occurrence] parameter set, the SELECT command is dispatched to the Application, - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [next occurrence] parameter set, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,"""
label: nonsec

requirement: In the eventuality that the current Application Session has been terminated and no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall make an attempt to select the Application that is marked as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for the current card interface.
label: nonsec

requirement: At any time during a Card Session the OPEN may receive a request on the Basic Logical Channel to either open or close a Supplementary Logical Channel.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card only supports the Basic Logical Channel and has no concept of logical channel support, the MANAGE CHANNEL command is dispatched to the currently selected Application. In this case, when a Security Domain is the currently selected Application, the command shall be rejected.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""On cards that support logical channels, if a MANAGE CHANNEL [open] is received:   If an Application is designated as implicitly selectable on the new Supplementary Logical Channel for the current card interface, that Application is implicitly selected on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel and runtime behavior requirements apply,   Otherwise the Application designated as implicitly selectable on the Basic Logical Channel for this card interface is implicitly selected on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel and runtime behavior requirements apply."""
label: nonsec

requirement: On cards that support logical channels, if a MANAGE CHANNEL [close] is received, terminate the Application Session currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command and then close that logical channel. The Basic Logical Channel can never be closed.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, return the appropriate error.
label: nonsec

requirement: If the number of logical channels supported by the OPEN is not sufficient to open a new Supplementary Logical Channel, return the appropriate error.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""The OPEN shall search the GlobalPlatform Registry for the Application that supports the current card interface and that is marked as implicitly selectable on the new Supplementary Logical Channel (or failing that, on the Basic Logical Channel) and: - If this is an Application in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, the Application with the Final Application privilege shall become the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel, - If this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction, the new logical channel shall not be opened and the OPEN shall return the appropriate error, - Otherwise, the Supplementary Logical Channel is opened and this Application shall become the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel."""
label: nonsec

requirement: Once an Application becomes the selected Application on the Basic Logical Channel, the responsibility for subsequent command dispatching still rests with the OPEN.
label: nonsec

requirement: On cards that are aware of logical channels, the MANAGE CHANNEL commands are only processed by the OPEN and are not dispatched to an Application.
label: nonsec

requirement: All other commands (including the MANAGE CHANNEL commands on cards that are not aware of logical channels or SELECT commands not described in section 6.4.2.1.2 - Explicit Selection) are immediately dispatched to the Application currently selected on the Basic Logical Channel. The processing of the command by the Application is beyond the scope of this Specification.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""The OPEN shall support Application selection on an available Supplementary Logical Channel via two processes:   Implicit Selection following a successful MANAGE CHANNEL [open] command,   Explicit Selection through the SELECT [by name] command."""
label: nonsec

requirement: The OPEN may also support additional selection processes.
label: nonsec

requirement: Partial AID selection as defined in section 6.4.3.1.2 - Explicit Selection, shall be supported on Supplementary Logical Channels.
label: nonsec

requirement: At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN may receive a request to select an Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel (SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command). The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches an entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
label: nonsec

requirement: At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel that has already contained a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command since the Supplementary Logical Channel was last opened, the OPEN may receive a request to select a next Application (SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command) on this Supplementary Logical Channel. The OPEN shall determine if the requested AID matches or partially matches another entry within the GlobalPlatform Registry and whether this entry is selectable.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""For both the SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] command and the SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] command, an Application becomes the selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel if:   The requested AID matches (fully or partially) the Applications AID,   The Application being selected is in the correct Life Cycle State,   The Application has no restrictions due to multi-selection, and supports the current card interface."""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED: - Close the Supplementary Logical Channel, if currently open, - Return the appropriate error,"""
label: nonsec

requirement: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] or SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received and the data field of the command message is not present, the Issuer Security Domain shall become the currently selected Application and the SELECT command is dispatched to the Issuer Security Domain,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a SELECT [by name] [first or only occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the start of the GlobalPlatform Registry,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a SELECT [by name] [next occurrence] is received, the search always begins from the entry following the currently selected Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel in the GlobalPlatform Registry,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State INSTALLED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is in the Life Cycle State LOCKED, continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. In the eventuality that this locked Application is already currently selected on the same Supplementary Logical Channel, the OPEN shall terminate this Application Session. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""If a full or partial match is found and this Application cannot be selected due to a multi-selection restriction or because the Application refuses selection (e.g. because it does not support the current card interface), continue searching through the GlobalPlatform Registry for a subsequent full or partial match. If no subsequent full or partial match is found, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity,"""
label: nonsec

requirement: If a full or partial match is found and this Application is selectable (i.e. in the correct Life Cycle State and has no multi-selection restrictions), then it shall become the currently selected Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel and the SELECT [by name] command, whether [first or only occurrence] or [next occurrence], shall be processed according to the requirements of the runtime environment (e.g. dispatched to the Application),
label: nonsec
zero_shot_cot: To determine whether this is a security-related requirement (sec) or non-security related requirement (nonsec), we need to understand if the Application's selection and processing are associated with any security aspects. Here's how we can reason through the given requirement: 1. The Application must be in the correct Life Cycle State, which implies that it is operational and ready for interaction. 2. There should be no multi-selection restrictions, meaning only one Application can be selected at a time. 3. If a full or partial match is found, the Application becomes the currently selected Application on this Supplementary Logical Channel. 4. The SELECT [by name] command is processed according to the requirements of the runtime environment, which could include security-related actions. However, without explicit information about the nature of these actions, we cannot definitively label it as sec or nonsec. To provide a more accurate answer, additional context or specific details about the Application's functionality and the runtime environment's behavior are required.

requirement: " ""If no full or partial match is found at all, the currently selected Application on the Supplementary Logical Channel shall remain the selected Application and - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [first or only occurrence] parameter set, the SELECT command is dispatched to the Application, - If the SELECT [by name] command has the [next occurrence] parameter set, the OPEN shall return the appropriate error to the off-card entity."""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""At any time on an open Supplementary Logical Channel the OPEN may receive a request to either open or close a Supplementary Logical Channel. If a MANAGE CHANNEL [open] is received and the Application selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel has no multi-selection restrictions, this Application becomes the selected Application on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel. If a MANAGE CHANNEL [close] is received, terminate the Application Session currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command and then close that logical channel. The Basic Logical Channel can never be closed."""
label: nonsec

requirement: If the card is in the Life Cycle State CARD_LOCKED or TERMINATED, return the appropriate error,
label: nonsec

requirement: If the number of logical channels supported by the OPEN is not sufficient to open a new Supplementary Logical Channel, return the appropriate error,
label: nonsec

requirement: If the Application currently selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel cannot be selected on the new Supplementary Logical Channel due to a multi-selection restriction, the new logical channel shall not be opened and the OPEN shall return the appropriate error,
label: nonsec

requirement: Otherwise, the Supplementary Logical Channel indicated by the command is opened and the Application currently selected on the original Supplementary Logical Channel shall become the selected Application on the newly opened Supplementary Logical Channel.
label: nonsec

requirement: Once an Application becomes the selected Application on a Supplementary Logical Channel, the responsibility for subsequent command dispatching still rests with the OPEN.
label: nonsec

requirement: The MANAGE CHANNEL commands are only processed by the OPEN and are not dispatched to an Application.
label: nonsec

requirement: All other commands (including SELECT commands not described in section 6.4.3.1.2 - Explicit Selection) are immediately dispatched to the Application currently selected on the Supplementary Logical Channel. The processing of the command by the Application is beyond the scope of this Specification.
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""The GlobalPlatform Registry is used to:   Store card management information,   Store relevant application management information (e.g., AID, associated Security Domain and Privileges),   Support card resource management data,   Store Application Life Cycle information,   Store card Life Cycle information,   Track any counters associated with logs."""
label: nonsec

requirement: " ""The contents of the GlobalPlatform Registry may be updated in response to:   An internal OPEN invoked action,   An authorized Application invoked action."""
label: nonsec

requirement: All Applications including all Security Domains, and all Executable Load Files, shall have an entry in the GlobalPlatform Registry.
label: nonsec

requirement: Each Executable Load File or Executable Module is associated with an AID that shall be unique on the card.
label: nonsec

requirement: An Application AID may be the same as that of an Executable Module but may not be the same as that of an Executable Load File or the same as another Application already present in the GlobalPlatform Registry.
label: nonsec

requirement: This AID may be specified in a SELECT command to select the Application. It is not possible to select Executable Load Files or Executable Modules.
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.'

label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request.   As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request.  The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests.  The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information; the dispute case number  the type of retrieval requested (copy  original or portfolio)  and the date that the merchant response is due.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request.  The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information; the dispute case number  the type of chargeback requested (pending or immediate)  and the date that the merchant response is due.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction.  The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to  according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System must provide Search functionality.  The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number  (2) the merchant account number  (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number.  In addition to the above criteria  the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range  the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification)  the case status (open  closed or all) and the dispute reason code.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user.  The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list.  For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions.  The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system.  A detailed history of the actions taken on the case  including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process  a case activity will be generated.  Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'All letter requests must be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.'
label: nonsec

requirement: 'Any disputes cases that have been closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.'
